headline: Greek Orzo Salad
description: This orzo salad combines marinated artichoke hearts, cucumber, feta, tomato, olives, and a zesty dressing for a healthy, colorful, light meal or side.
name: Greek Orzo Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes; drain.
Combine pasta, artichoke hearts, cucumber, tomato, onion, feta, olives, parsley, lemon juice, oregano, and lemon pepper in a large bowl; toss well. Chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Just before serving, drizzle reserved artichoke marinade over salad.

review.reviewBody: LOVE IT!!

I have made this in the past with the ingredients listed and it was fabulous. This time around I found myself with no tomatoes (I know, a sin in my house) so I substituted with roasted red bell peppers. I also added a package of smoked salmon ...so good ...I have so many leftovers that meal planning for work this week will be a breeze!

This was good...i did make a few changes...i used both fresh parsley and oregano...peeled the cucumber...used grape tomatoes...green olives instead of black..only 1 can of artichoke hearts and i did NOT use the juice from the can instead i used about 1/4c of greek salad dressing. It was great. My daughter didnt care for the texture of the orzo but loved the taste...i think this could also be good using about 3c of couscous in place of the orzo.
Yes I made it. It needs more flavor. I made it b4, i used zesty Italian dressing. I was good.
This is a great recipe. It seemed a bit bland so I added 3 tablespoons of Mediterranean salad dressing (Aldi's) to give it some zest. Perfect!

I added 1/2 cup Greek salad dressing and a splash from the artichoke marinade. I use a pint of grape tomatoes cut in half,and I soak the red onions in water. This is over the top delicious! The leftovers are excellent too. Iâ€™m making it again today, the second time in 2 weeks.
Enjoyed this recipe. Used plain hearts instead of marinated because recipe sounded salty Tossed with a lemon vinaigrette. It is a keeper
Delicious - Loved it!
This was delicious, followed your recipe exactly as you said. This will be on my list of make again great pastas. My family and I LOVE pastas ðŸ¥°.
Be sure to use Kalamata olives, not those tasteless black 'ripe olives'. Kalamatas are real Greek flavor.

Omg! I could not stop eating this! Itâ€™s so flipping delicious and so much wonderful flavor. How can you go wrong with artichoke hearts & (I used Kalamata) olives! It didnâ€™t last long, so, darn, it looks like Iâ€™ll have to make some more!

I am not a big cook, but I needed a salad/appetizer and found this recipe. It was easy to do and ended up tasting better than I expected. My family and friends agreed and were stunned to find out that I had made it.

I made it exactly as written and it was pretty bland. I used Kalamata olives and let it sit overnight in the refrigerator. Maybe it was the brand of marinated artichoke hearts I used that lacked umph...

The original recipe makes a huge batch! Next time I will cut the orzo in half and double the cukes and tomatoes. I also used a mixture of olive oil, oregano, salt, and lemon juice in place of the artichoke marinade. Overall a very easy and tasty dish!
I am now officially a Greek orzo salad addict. I have lived off of it for 4 to 5 days on numerous occasions.
Meh. Not a big fan tbh.

Made this exactly as stated and it was DELISH! I have already shared it with my favorite ladies who love this kind of salad...it was that good. Whoever commented that it was dry and lacked flavor had to of done something wrong because that is not the case. I will be making this again...and again...

Followed recipe, added kalamata olives, didn't have lemon pepper so just added some pepper. This makes a huge bowl, more than 6 servings. Added a little bit of creamy caesar dressing the next day. Very refreshing salad. I think next time I will use less Orzo to make it even healthier.

The foundations of this recipe are absolutely great! As many other reviewers did, though, I tweaked. I used Marie's Greek Salad Dressing (not too overbearing) instead of the marinade, left out the red onion, and doubled up on the lemon. In the future, I'll probably cut down on the amount of orzo. It's up to one's own taste, and I wanted to make this mostly a salad rather than a cold pasta dish. As others did, I gave it more time in the refrigerator, giving it more time to meld those wonderful fresh ingredients. Will definitely be doing again!

this came out amazing. before I poured artichoke juice on the salad I did a sample of it with just the artichoke juice, and then another sample of it with Greek salad dressing, then another sample with the combination of both Greek dressing Ken's brand and the artichoke juice. The combination of the Greek dressing on the artichoke juice was much better. The artichoke juice made it two artichokie flavor.
Was easy to make. Used kalamata olives instead of black olives.
This was a hit! Will be making it again.
This was a hit! Will be making it again.

I made this recipe using the EXACT ingredients listed. After chilling a couple of hours we decided we did not need to use the reserve artichoke marinade. The salad was delicious and moist. The olives, tomatoes & cucumbers saw to that. Thank you for sharing, will definitely be made again & again. It was quick & easy. We also like the addition of the lemon pepper seasoning, very good...
Made it with exactly the ingredients listed and it was very good! I added the brine from the artichokes with everything else at the beginning; not sure why you need to wait. Thanks!
This is an absolutely delicious and easy recipe! Will be making it again and again, this summer! Many thanks for posting this!
It was good i will make again.
This is a got to recipe for a picnic! I make it just as written. Thank you - this is always a hit.
Delicious salad, will make it again!
Loved the Greek lemon dressing!
I love this salad! So good but definitely needs kalamata olives instead of black!
Very good but next time no parsley
Very tasty! I added a tiny pinch of salt because I like things quite salty but otherwise, I wouldn't change a thing!
I didnâ€™t have marinated artichoke hearts, so I couldnâ€™t reserve the liquid. I drizzled Italian salad dressing before serving. Delicious!
I made this tonight...turned out great!

First time I made this exactly as the recipe called. It was a big hit with the family and at the July 4th party we went to. Instead of the black olives, I now use green olives. It gives it an extra tangy. This recipe is definitely a keeper either way.
Great recipe for big groups! Made it for several pool parties this summer! Only modification is I put Kalamata olives and did a lot more lemon juice! It was a hit!
Delicious! I will be making this again. Makes quite a large salad, could easily be halved.
Very yummy! I added grilled shrimp and made it a main dish.
very tasty. Did not change a thing. Makes a large amount, way more than 6 servings. Good salad for a pot luck.

Never used orzo before and wonâ€™t again. The instructions should have said to completely cool the cooked orzo before combining with the other ingredients. There was enough warmth left that when combining the orzo and other ingredients it created a slimy mess that smelled ok but was a disgusting texture. Not really excited to try it again, would rather have had a salad with crisp veggies.
Makes a pretty big amount. Unless you have a large family or are taking to pot luck Iâ€™d cut it in half
Outstanding salad!

I am rating this based on the suggested changes and my own changes. I am currently eating low carb (kind of a dirty keto woe) and used riced cauliflower(made twice once baking the riced cauliflower and once just straight out of the bag- loved both) instead of orzo pasta. I also used the dressing from Dining Diva- Instead of using the artichoke marinade. Use 6 tbsp olive oil, 5 tbsp red wine vinegar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and 2 teaspoon dried oregano. And did 1/2 black olives and 1/2 kalamata olives. It was amazing and very keto/low carb friendly.
Delicious. I made a Greek vinaigrette instead of the artichoke marinade. Added a small amount of Greek seasoning. I will make it again.

Excellent recipe and a total party pleaser. Just as an FYI, 1 1/2 cups of dried orzo makes a bunch!! I had to add more cucumbers and tomatoes as there was so much cooked orzo! Will definitely make it again!
Made this it was delicious and definitely would make it again !
This is the best salad Iâ€™ve ever made! Made it for a big family dinner and everyone loved it!
I used only 1 cup of orzo. I wanted it to lean more toward the veggies. It was good.

I made this for a bbq this past weekend and it was the hit of the day!! Easy to make and much flavor. I opted for miniature cucumbers instead of the larger ones, The only change I would make is to add a little more artichoke. Its light and cool and fresh!!
I did not have the artichokes- would try it another time with them. I added some Balsamic vinegar.
Doubled the recipe for a pot luck luncheon. Received good feedback from everyone. I loved it, too.
I made this. It was super easy and tasted great! The only thing I changed was to add only 1/2 of the red onion instead of the full onion.
Good, but needed more zip. Next time will add more pepper and lemon juice.
Love this salad & so did everyone else. Would probably cut back orzo to 1 cup next time. I just like less pasta.
I took this dish to a luncheon and it was a hit! Everyone loved how fresh and light it was. This is perfect.
Love this recipe! Always a request teamed up with BBQ chicken. We love the recipe just the way it is directed, but enjoy reading how others change it up! Thanks for another great recipe!
I really liked this salad. I made some changes to the dressing like others suggested and left out the artichoke because Iâ€™m not fond of it. I also used kalamata olives, which added a nice flavour.

I made this recipe for a Lunch barbecue for a few friends and family. I made enough for 20 people and they only variation to the recipe was that I did not use black olives due to the fact that there were several people in the family who didnâ€™t like them. I personally will add them the next time I make this recipe and will use it again it was delicious and a big hit with everybody!

This was delicious and very simple... a great make-ahead dish. I used leftover orzo, and my small changes were to use kalamata olives instead of black, Greek dressing instead of the marinade from the artichokes, two seeded Roma tomatoes, and a shallot instead of a red onion. I also used fresh herbs from our garden. I cut all the veggies pretty finely for consistency, and it turned out to be a light and tasty early summer meal. you could easily add marinated shrimp or chicken for a heartier version, but this suited us just fine. Hubby and I agree... it's a keeper!
Awesome flavor explosion in your mouth! I also added some freshly pressed garlic (2 cloves) it was delicious. Also added red peppers inserted of tomato (didn't have any).

Tastes really good, but it does make a lot - way more than six servings! Like others, I used a good bottled Greek Salad dressing (not a creamy one made with yogurt, but an oil and vinegar based one with feta cheese and Greek spices) instead of using the artichoke brine. I used sliced kalamata olives, halved grape tomatoes, and English cucumbers so that I didn't need to seed them. I doubled the feta, cucumbers, tomatoes and olives, and gave it an extra tablespoon of lemon juice and a splash of white wine vinegar, as the salad dressing didn't seem to have enough oomph. I think that refrigerating it overnight melded the flavors together well. It was very popular at my potluck BBQ!

This was quick to throw together and tasted fantastic! I didn't use the marinade from the artichokes because it was made of water and oil. Instead I drizzled extra virgin olive oil and red wine vinegar over the salad. I also used goat cheese instead of feta. I will make this again next time I'm asked to "bring a dish"!

Made it Saturday for a Monday work party based on reviews that said it is better a day or two later. But I snuck some for dinner and it was pretty good. I made other suggested changes as well. So I am rating based being a great base that is flexible to modification. Can't wait to see how it turns out on Monday.
Great recipe. I find that adding chopped basil and toasted pine nuts really makes it amazing.
This was so good. Everyone loved it. Will be making it again.
Wonderful mix of flavor & texture. This recipe makes a good amount and does not keep well, even overnight so plan well when making it.

Perhaps this would be better if I used a different brand of artichokes (I used Cento brand), but the flavor was pretty awful with a sour aftertaste that lingered. I think this would taste so much better with a fresh dressing made simply from lemon juice, red wine vinegar, olive oil, and more fresh seasonings. The lemon pepper doesnâ€™t work here, and fresh oregano would be much better.
Ook
Great recipe! Loved it

Used Dining Divaâ€™s oil and vinegar recommendation and canned artichokes rather than marinated. Also used yellow onion instead of red because it was on hand. Red would be better. It even better the third day- make ahead! Yummy with sliced up chicken mixed in for lunch also.

This complimented our Venison Gyros ..... followed as directed this is awesome, no dressing used just the Orzo and the Veggies and the juice from the meat ... which was minimal but absolutly perfect dipping bread and flour tortillas!

I liked all the ingredients - and added my usual DIY Greek spice blend as well. I didnâ€™t really like the lemon flavour. Will try with balsamic or red wine vinegar next time. I counterbalances the acidic taste with some stevia and that helped.
I loved this. it was the prefect combination of savory and salty for a summer dinner side dish!

It was so wonderful! Now I did use goat cheese instead of feta, because for some reason I just, really dislike feta. (I really don't like olives either, but I found I genuinely enjoyed them in this pasta salad.) So mine was more of a creamy pasta salad. But it was so delicious! I made it for a work luncheon, and everyone really enjoyed it.
The fresh parsley was a little overwhelming. I will not add it the next time I make it. I also used a greek salad dressing and no artichokes. I added rotisserie chicken to make it a meal.

The salad itself is great, but my husband and I agree that it was a bit flavorless. Had I seen the review to add red wine vinegar instead of the artichoke marinade I would have done that. Might still do that with the leftovers. Other than that, it was great for a hot day when I didnâ€™t want to eat anything warm.

I did as another reviewer recommended. 6 tablespoons of oil (I had some lemon Olive oil so used 2 tbls of that and 4 regular olive oil) and also 5 tablespoons of red wine vinegar. I also added about 1/2 teaspoon of dried lemon peel and 1 tsp of dried greek oregano. A little splash of the artichoke marinade as well. Without all of the above it seemed drab and dry.
I used cherry tomatoes in lieu of a whole large tomatoes also.
We make this quite often, and we definitely enjoy it, but we usually have to make extra dressing.

Loved this! Made it for a large family gathering and it was a hit. Per other suggestions I added more lemon juice, used a Greek salad dressing instead of the artichoke marinade, kalamata olives and added some pepperoncini.

I really liked this. I think itâ€™s a smoother version of a typical pasta salad youâ€™d find at a Fourth of July picnic because of the orzo. I did as others suggested and added the marinade ahead of time to let everything soak up the flavor. I will be making this again.

I had to wait to make this for Canada Day because our family like to make all our favourites then nominate one person to make a new salad for our feast. This was my year and I choice this Greek salad. It is great and will be used at many BBQ's in the coming years. Thanks you our family eats well every day of the year not just holidays
Excellent salad
Delicious! I made exactly as written. Next time I may add a little more Feta and Kalamata olives.
Definitely making it again - Big Hit

This is a grÃ©Ã¢t salad. It's simple to make. It makes a lot so it's grÃ©Ã¢t if you're having a party or going to a party. I did follow the suggestion of a reviewer who said to use olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice and dried oregano for the dressing. If you like Greek salad, you'll like this salad. Also, I used the grape tomatoes and cut them in half. In my area, the regular tomatoes are tasteless until late in the summer. Please don't complain about my minor changes and the five star rating. Sometimes we all just have to tweak a little bit.
Delicious! Family and a visiting friend loved it. Will definitely make this again.
very easy to make and delicious.
It was one of my favorite salads. Took it to a ladies salad luncheon and had compliments on it
I could live on this salad. Nice and cool for the summer.

This was awesome! Used reduced fat feta, and only half the artichoke out of caution that it was going to be too strong. Will definitely use the full amount next time, but even with the half it was delicious!!
It was okay. Needs something different, but can't put my finger on what, and didn't love the addition of the artichoke hearts.

The Greek Orzo Salad was REALLY GOOD! It was colorful and delicious. I did not add the artichoke hearts and olives because I'm not a big fan of those. I also added olive oil instead of lemon juice and added some Tavern Ham. I will DEFINITELY make this dish again. 100%

this is a really yummy salad! lots of prep time, tho I tripled the recipe thus tripling prep time. I personally would use less orzo next time or even leave out the pasta all together. I really love all the ingredients and the flavors and spices mesh well together. Will definately make agian!
This is a very easy to make recipe. But, I think what I like the most is that the simplicity allows you to personalize it
Great recipe, entire family loved it!
I like that it does not waste anything, using the liquid from the artichokes as the dressing. Yummy and colorful salad, great for potlucks.

I don't do artichokes, but other than that, I always try to make a recipe as written - at least the first time. It was pretty good, but it was better the second time around, when I merged with another recipe. I just thought it was a little bland, but I recognize that my preferences are just that: personal, and not everyone will agree with them. Thanks for a good starting place.
It's very tasty but I used greek Vinegrette dressing. I also switched the olives to greek olives.
